intro: Grazielia, commonly known as the golden trumpet tree, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, pendulous yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and can grow as a shrub or small tree. Grazielia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
